properties.description: Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) is the single most important task to conduct at the beginning of every data science project.

content.query:
/*Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) is the single 
most important task to conduct at the beginning of every data science project.*/

Select
     TOP(10) [Organisation Name], /*-- Name of the Organisation*/
     [Town/City],/*The City or town they are located*/
     [County], /*County they are located in*/
     [Type & Rating],/* Type and rating of sponsors*/
     [Route] /*Type of route visa offered*/
from Uksponsor.sponsors

Select DISTINCT [Type & Rating] from Uksponsor.sponsors


/*Number of missing Values per columns
Large proportion of my missing 
values are in the county column
*/

SELECT 
    COUNT(*) AS num_missing_values
    FROM Uksponsor.sponsors
WHERE County IS NULL;

SELECT COUNT(*) AS num_missing_values
    FROM Uksponsor.sponsors
WHERE [Route] IS NULL;


SELECT COUNT(*) AS num_missing_values
    FROM Uksponsor.sponsors
WHERE [Type & Rating] IS NULL;


SELECT COUNT(*) AS num_missing_values
    FROM Uksponsor.sponsors
WHERE [Town/City] IS NULL;



/* Checking for duplicate values*/

SELECT [Organisation Name], COUNT(*) as count
FROM Uksponsor.sponsors
GROUP BY [Organisation Name]
HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
/* Most of compaines appear more than once, my hypotesis is that maybe a company has registerd to offer
different kind of visas. for example one company may be offering both skilled worker routes and another type of visa.

Upon further investigation i was correct. for example 10 Europe Limited offers a skilled woker visa and 
Global Business Mobility: Senior or Specialist Worker visa Route. */

select [Organisation Name], [Town/City], [County],[Type & Rating], [Route]
from Uksponsor.sponsors
WHERE [Organisation Name] = '10 Europe Limited'


/*How Many Records are in this dataset*/
/* As of 19th February about 103,255 companies have registred for license to sponsor workers*/
Select 
    COUNT(*) as total_number_of_companies
from Uksponsor.sponsors



/* What are the distinct cities and how many visa are offered  */
Select 
DISTINCT [Town/City], COUNT([Route]) as Total_VisaRoute
from Uksponsor.sponsors
GROUP BY [Town/City] 
ORDER BY Total_VisaRoute DESC

/* What are the distinct Route and how frequently do they appear */
Select
    DISTINCT[Route], Count(*) as countno
    from Uksponsor.sponsors
GROUP BY [Route]
ORDER BY countno DESC


/* What are the distinct County and how frequently do they appear  */
Select
    DISTINCT[County], Count(*) as countno
    from Uksponsor.sponsors
GROUP BY [County]
ORDER BY countno DESC

/* What are the distinct county and how many visa are offered  */
Select 
DISTINCT [County], COUNT([Route]) as Total_VisaRoute
from Uksponsor.sponsors
GROUP BY [County] 
ORDER BY Total_VisaRoute DESC


/* What are the distinct Type Rating*/
Select DISTINCT [Type & Rating],Count(*) as countno
from Uksponsor.sponsors
GROUP BY [Type & Rating]
ORDER BY countno DESC




SELECT * FROM Uksponsor.sponsors
WHERE [Town/City] = 'London' and [Route] = 'Skilled Worker'
